title: news.com.au — Australia’s #1 news site
text: South Australia's debt is set to swell to the highest in the nation prompting the state’s Auditor-General, Andrew Richardson, to issue a warning to the state government. The state’s public sector net debt is expected to increase from $13.5 billion to $21.3 billion over the next four years – in excess of the expected growth in the state’s revenue. South Australia’s Auditor-General said there was an increased risk the government would have less capability and flexibility to spend on services as it met higher borrowing costs.
